news_header: Indian climate activist Sonam Wangchuk ends a 16-day hunger strike, continuing his fight for ecological preservation and autonomy for Ladakh.
news_text: Sonam Wangchuk, a prominent Indian climate activist, recently ended a 16-day hunger strike aimed at advocating for ecological protection and greater autonomy for Ladakh, his home region. Following the revocation of Ladakh's special status in 2019, locals have expressed concerns over rapid infrastructure development harming their fragile environment. Wangchuk, known for his innovative engineering solutions, has led protests demanding constitutional safeguards under the Sixth Schedule to protect local interests. His efforts have kept the plight of Ladakh in the media spotlight, and he remains hopeful for constructive talks with the government to address these issues.
